comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: https://hoodtrendspredict.com/ : detection
issue.body:
### Platform

Android

### Protocol

DNS-over-TLS

### Do you use AdGuard app?

No I don't

### Your configuration

Using Android-14 in Xiaomi Redmi Phone
Browser : Chrome

### Traceroute to AdGuard DNS

_No response_

### Issue Details

I am using private dns option and host : (dns.adguard.com) in my android phone.

There is no other ad blocker in my phone except adguard.
Previously when i went to this website there was no problem but recently when i tried to go this website a prompt / pop up came.

Website: [https://hoodtrendspredict.com/]

A pop up arise "Ads Blocker Detected!!!
We have detected that you are using extensions to block ads. Please support us by disabling these ads blocker. Thank You 
**Powered By chp adblock."**


### Expected Behavior

No popup show as ad blocker detected .

### Actual Behavior

A pop up arise "Ads Blocker Detected!!!
We have detected that you are using extensions to block ads. Please support us by disabling these ads blocker. Thank You 
**Powered By chp adblock."**

### Screenshots

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>
<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![SS](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/94c9f4b2-ebc6-41c8-bbb7-2437a51bc64e)
</details>

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

issue.title: hoodtrendspredict.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Platform

Android

### Protocol

DNS-over-TLS

### Do you use AdGuard app?

No I don't

### Your configuration

Using Android-14 in Xiaomi Redmi Phone
Browser : Chrome

### Traceroute to AdGuard DNS

_No response_

### Issue Details

I am using private dns option and host : (dns.adguard.com) in my android phone.

There is no other ad blocker in my phone except adguard.
Previously when i went to this website there was no problem but recently when i tried to go this website a prompt / pop up came.

Website: [https://hoodtrendspredict.com/]

A pop up arise "Ads Blocker Detected!!!
We have detected that you are using extensions to block ads. Please support us by disabling these ads blocker. Thank You 
**Powered By chp adblock."**


### Expected Behavior

No popup show as ad blocker detected .

### Actual Behavior

A pop up arise "Ads Blocker Detected!!!
We have detected that you are using extensions to block ads. Please support us by disabling these ads blocker. Thank You 
**Powered By chp adblock."**

### Screenshots

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>
<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![SS](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/94c9f4b2-ebc6-41c8-bbb7-2437a51bc64e)
</details>


### Additional Information

_No response_

comment.body:
If you only use AdGuard DNS, that won't be enough. You can switch to AdGuard Non-filtering DNS or Private DNS and unblock the necessary request there.
However, it was fixed in the filters, so it's best to install [AdGuard for Android](https://adguard.com/adguard-android/overview.html). Update should be available in 2-3 hours.

issue.title: www.apkmirror.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

pull_request.title: Bump markdownlint-cli from 0.41.0 to 0.43.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps [markdownlint-cli](https://github.com/igorshubovych/markdownlint-cli) from 0.41.0 to 0.43.0.
Release notes

Sourced from markdownlint-cli's releases.

v0.43.0

  • Update markdownlint dependency to 0.36.1
    • Improve MD051
    • Make micromark parser available to custom rules
    • Improve performance
  • Update all dependencies via Dependabot

v0.42.0

  • Update markdownlint dependency to 0.35.0
    • Add MD058/blanks-around-tables
    • Use micromark in MD001/MD003/MD009/MD010/MD013/MD014/MD019/MD021/MD023/MD024/MD025/MD039/MD042/MD043
    • Improve MD018/MD020/MD031/MD034/MD044
    • markdown-it parser no longer invoked by default
    • Improve performance
  • Update all dependencies via Dependabot
Commits
  • 0d9fcb5 Bump version 0.43.0
  • 5ea894c Bump smol-toml from 1.3.0 to 1.3.1
  • d6addd9 Replace get-stdin package dependency with node:stream/consumers.
  • e08f9cd Update code for new markdownlint library version.
  • 1fff3f2 Bump markdownlint from 0.35.0 to 0.36.1
  • 9377bc0 Bump ava from 6.1.3 to 6.2.0
  • 43a24cc Bump nano-spawn from 0.1.0 to 0.2.0
  • aa975a1 Bump version 0.42.0
  • 789dda8 Bump execa from 9.3.1 to 9.4.0
  • 15479aa Replace dev dependency execa with nano-spawn (smaller, 0 dependencies).
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=markdownlint-cli&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=0.41.0&new-version=0.43.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

Sourced from markdownlint-cli's releases.

v0.43.0

  • Update markdownlint dependency to 0.36.1
    • Improve MD051
    • Make micromark parser available to custom rules
    • Improve performance
  • Update all dependencies via Dependabot

v0.42.0

  • Update markdownlint dependency to 0.35.0
    • Add MD058/blanks-around-tables
    • Use micromark in MD001/MD003/MD009/MD010/MD013/MD014/MD019/MD021/MD023/MD024/MD025/MD039/MD042/MD043
    • Improve MD018/MD020/MD031/MD034/MD044
    • markdown-it parser no longer invoked by default
    • Improve performance
  • Update all dependencies via Dependabot
Commits
  • 0d9fcb5 Bump version 0.43.0
  • 5ea894c Bump smol-toml from 1.3.0 to 1.3.1
  • d6addd9 Replace get-stdin package dependency with node:stream/consumers.
  • e08f9cd Update code for new markdownlint library version.
  • 1fff3f2 Bump markdownlint from 0.35.0 to 0.36.1
  • 9377bc0 Bump ava from 6.1.3 to 6.2.0
  • 43a24cc Bump nano-spawn from 0.1.0 to 0.2.0
  • aa975a1 Bump version 0.42.0
  • 789dda8 Bump execa from 9.3.1 to 9.4.0
  • 15479aa Replace dev dependency execa with nano-spawn (smaller, 0 dependencies).
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body:
@piquark6046 Maybe I didn't explain the situation in the comment section of the previous report clearly.

Currently, I am not using AdGuard, but uBlock Origin. uBlock Origin has its own base filter list, but the regional/language-specific filter lists are taken from AdGuard.

Bing has a China-specific version ([https://cn.bing.com]()), which may redirect you to the main site if you are not accessing with a China IP. I think it is a better idea to put the related rules into the Chinese specific list.

The Chinese specific list does have rules related to the China-specific Bing. However, it seems that Bing updated its layout a few days ago, so the existing rules are no longer in effect.

I have investigated the new layout and proposed the following rule, hoping that it could be added to the AdGuard Chinese filter list:
```
cn.bing.com##li.b_algo:has(p:matches-attr("class"=/b_algoSlug/))
```

@Alex-302 In my screenshot, the little "" in the search results means "Advertisement". I am searching for the regulations on hazardous chemical reagents, but those search results instigate me to buying those reagents on some arbitrary websites. So they are ads definitely.

The previous report was submitted using the automatic tool, so my intention may not be that clear. Sorry for any inconvenience.
